title: Christopher Maye
text:
Christopher Maye (born 28 February 1984) is a former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 2000s. He played at representative level for <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Ireland</a>, and at club level for the <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> (<a href="Reserve%20team">A-Team</a>), <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> (<a href="Reserve%20team">A-Team</a>), <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Halifax%20R.L.F.C.%20players">Heritage № 1181</a>), the <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton Lions</a> and <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Oldham%20R.L.F.C.%20players">Heritage №</a>), as a , or , i.e. number 3 or 4, or 13.
Playing career.
Club career.
Maye was transferred from the <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> to <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a>.
International honours.
Chris Maye won four caps (plus one as substitute) for <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Ireland</a> in 2003–2004 while at St. Helens, and the Swinton Lions.
Genealogical information.
Chris Maye is the nephew of the rugby league footballer; <a href="Chris%20Joynt">Chris Joynt</a>.
